intro: Hedeoma nana, commonly known as dwarf hedeoma, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold, moist environments. The plant has a compact growth habit with small, spoon-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences and are usually pink or purple in color. Hedeoma nana is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is adapted to survive in harsh, high-latitude climates.
